edu.cmu.sei.arche
Class ArchEException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          edu.cmu.sei.arche.ArchEException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ArchEException
extends java.lang.Exception

A checked exception representing a failure in ArchE. The message in the exception describes the failure.

Author:
Paulo Merson
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
ArchEException()
          Creates a new ArchE exception.
ArchEException(java.lang.String message)
          Creates a new ArchE exception with a message.
ArchEException(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Throwable cause)
          Creates a new ArchE exception with message and a nested exception.
 
Method Summary
 void printStackTrace()
          Prints a stack trace to the standard error device for the exception, and any nested exception.

Constructor Detail

ArchEException

public ArchEException()
Creates a new ArchE exception.

ArchEException

public ArchEException(java.lang.String message)
Creates a new ArchE exception with a message.

Parameters:
message - the exception message

ArchEException

public ArchEException(java.lang.String message,
                      java.lang.Throwable cause)
Creates a new ArchE exception with message and a nested exception.

Parameters:
message - the exception message
cause - the cause (which is saved for later retrieval by the Throwable.getCause() method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)
Method Detail

printStackTrace

public void printStackTrace()
Prints a stack trace to the standard error device for the exception, and any nested exception. (Uses std err so that it prints in red in Eclipse console)
